Sentencas: Although fuel cells work efficiently with hydrogen as a fuel there are still some major problems related to hydrogen availability and acceptability.
Titulo: Improved Oxidation of Hydrocarbons with New Electrodes in High Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In particular, it is still extremely difficult to obtain clean/renewable hydrogen.
Titulo: Improved Oxidation of Hydrocarbons with New Electrodes in High Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In the short to medium term future, the only realistic fuels for fuel cells are hydrocarbon based, especially natural gas.
Titulo: Improved Oxidation of Hydrocarbons with New Electrodes in High Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In this article, we address the optimal use of hydrocarbon fuels in high temperature, solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Improved Oxidation of Hydrocarbons with New Electrodes in High Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In conventional solid oxide fuel cells, the hydrocarbon fuel is typically reformed with large quantities of steam over nickel externally to the fuel cell.
Titulo: Improved Oxidation of Hydrocarbons with New Electrodes in High Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Internal reforming is a more attractive process that can occur at the Nickel/zirconia cermets that are generally used as fuel electrodes.
Titulo: Improved Oxidation of Hydrocarbons with New Electrodes in High Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The various complicated steps that occur during this process are reviewed and discussed, paying particular attention to the hydrocarbon cracking reactions that often occur at low steam levels.
Titulo: Improved Oxidation of Hydrocarbons with New Electrodes in High Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: There are a number of new materials, such as those based on lanthanum chromate, that offer improved resistance to hydrocarbon cracking at low steam partial pressures.
Titulo: Improved Oxidation of Hydrocarbons with New Electrodes in High Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Of particular relevance; is the concept of gradual internal reforming, whereby steam generated during the initial oxidation reaction is used to drive further reforming reactions.
Titulo: Improved Oxidation of Hydrocarbons with New Electrodes in High Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: A further process, direct oxidation can also occur at low steam partial pressures.
Titulo: Improved Oxidation of Hydrocarbons with New Electrodes in High Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: This process offers the ultimate in thermodynamic efficiency, almost 100 percent theoretically, which renders it very attractive.
Titulo: Improved Oxidation of Hydrocarbons with New Electrodes in High Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Some very good success has been reported with copper ceria electrodes, with direct oxidation claimed at temperatures up to 700 degrees C.
Titulo: Improved Oxidation of Hydrocarbons with New Electrodes in High Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The performance of a number of new oxide electrodes with perovskite, fluorite and related structures is reviewed.
Titulo: Improved Oxidation of Hydrocarbons with New Electrodes in High Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: A particularly important conclusion is the importance of mixed conductivity for optimising catalytic performance.
Titulo: Improved Oxidation of Hydrocarbons with New Electrodes in High Temperature Fuel Cells
